Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Justice today announced a settlement with Guardian Industries Corp. that will resolve a Clean Air Act enforcement action involving Guardian's flat glass manufacturing facilities throughout the United States. Under the settlement, Guardian agreed to pay a $312,000 penalty and spend more than $70 million to install air pollution control equipment. In addition, Guardian was to fund an environmental mitigation project valued at $150,000 to reduce particulate matter pollution in the San Joaquin Valley in California.
